articles.title: Hello world - Changelog and Event tags
articles.description: Our weekly changelog is now live ‚ú®
articles.content:
## What's new this week

We now have a public Changelog that we'll use to share our product changes on a weekly basis.


As our users generally struggle keeping their event list organised we decided to introduce a **event tagging** feature


PS: If you like the style of our changelog we've got some good news - it's [open source](https://github.com/ferrucc-io/weekly-changelog)

articles.title: Retention template
articles.content:
# **Retention template** For most of you who are pre product-market fit, we heard retention is the #1 metrics you wish to measure and move. We're happy to share that the first version of the retention template is now released üéâ
Getting started with this template is dead-simple: - pick the event for when a user signs up (ex: signed_up) - pick the event(s) for when a user is active. This is at your discretion and can be either loose - ex: when a user logs in - or conservative, ex: when a user completes a specific set of actions
Today the Retention is available per week and for 12 weeks only. We'll make the setup and time range more flexible over time! Stay tuned üìª
# **Other improvements** - Bug fixing on how templates are computed - Getting ready to allow multiple copies of templates

articles.title: New Website
articles.content:
**New website**
We released [our website](http://june.so/) to the world üåé
It is a step toward sharing more about our product vision. We hope you like it!

**Recruiting**
We just opened the first engineering position at June : [https://www.notion.so/Founding-Engineer-339274009f594b58aff3d4bfd8e3f93e](https://www.notion.so/Founding-Engineer-339274009f594b58aff3d4bfd8e3f93e)
This is an unique opportunity to join our founding team and make a forever lasting impact in the analytics space. If you‚Äôre excited by the challenge, then COUNT YOURSELF IN! If you know someone who would, share the word üôè

articles.title: Power Users
articles.content:
**Power users**
Are you getting started with your product or recently launched a brand new feature? Then maybe you want to figure out who uses it most. Good news! We introduced the **Power User** template. Simply select the relevant tracking events and we generate a list of power users list. We even included users emails so you can reach directly to them üòâ

**Invite teammates**
Want to invite a teammate to collaborate on June? Say no more, our invite system is released.

articles.title: Funnel template
articles.content:
**Funnel template** Funnels are everywhere. They are among the easiest way to vizualise the number of users who completed a step. Add your events to create a basic funnels and count the number of times a specific event was triggered. Turn the "unique user" toggle on if you want to count by unique customers only üí™
You can use funnels for:
‚Äî Acquisition: Signup funnel
‚Äî Activation: Onboarding funnel, feature activation funnel
‚Äî Virality: Team invite funnel
‚Äî Monetization: Free-to-Paid funnel
‚Äî Testing: Fake door button funnel
üí°Note: If you have more than one use case we'll soon allow you to duplicate this template.
**Power users template updated** If you are pre product-market fit then identifying your most active users and reaching out to them is a great way to understand what value they are getting from your product. This is now possible by specific time range ‚è±

articles.title: Active users
articles.content:
**Active users template** In the early days of your product - or a new feature - you may want to know who sticks with it.

This is often referred as being **active**. The "active users" template helps you pick the tracking event(s) for which your users are active.

To get the best out of this template you may go:
‚Äî for a loose definition and pick your "log in" event
‚Äî or be more restrictive and pick a combination of events that needs to be met
**Slipping away template**
Knowing which customers slip away from your product is a simple yet amazing way to re-engage with them and understand why.

This template gives you a list of customers slipping away with their email addresses üíå
**Other improvements**
‚Äî Bug fixes: redirect to Segment app during the initial set up

articles.title: Time picker
articles.content:
**Time picker** We're adding a simple and visual way to pick the time for which you wish to run your analyses. Choose the default time range to move even faster your analyses forward, or pick the custom date picker if needs be.
**Other improvements**
‚Äî Faster app and shorter loading time üöÄ

articles.title: Event mapping
articles.content:
**Event mapping** Mapping events to a template has become even more simple! With the new workflow, June guides you step by step and tell you precisely which events should be added to a template. In case you don't have the right event we even tell you what and where it should be implemented.
**Other improvements**
‚Äî User list redesigned: identifying and segmenting your users and visitors can be done at a glance.

articles.title: Reports
articles.content:
**Reports** You can now have multiple copies of a single template üëØ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüëØ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. This allows you for instance to run several feature audit or funnel analyses. The new "Reports" section allows to keep a clean record of your analyses as well.
**Other improvements**
‚Äî Improvements on audience filters
‚Äî "3 Month retention" graph redesigned
‚Äî Template header redesigned

articles.title: Insights
articles.content:
**Insights** What's the point of having graphs if you don't know how to read into them? Today we're introducing insights, the fastest way ever built to understand your data in the real world üåç Insights are available for Retention and Active users - and very üîú on Feature Audit template.
**Other improvements**
‚Äî Graphs digits rounded & faster queries ‚ö°Ô∏è
‚Äî Navigation sidebar for reports üëà

articles.title: Slack
articles.content:
**Slack** June is available on Slack! Activate the app on your favorite templates. Then receive alerts in Slack for any significant changes. No more time or information wasted ([learn more](https://intercom.help/junedotso/en/articles/4803772-slack-integration)).
**Other improvements**
‚Äî Active user, Slipping away & Power user templates design polished üíÖ

articles.title: Feature audit insights
articles.content:
**Feature audit insights** Insights are now available on your feature audits. Insights help you understand which part of your product your customers come back for. They help you focus on the right features.
**Other improvements**
‚Äî Zoomed in view on customer when clicking your funnels üîç ![slack-notification.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/slack_notification_c750ec233f.png)
‚Äî Slack app: DAU daily reports üìú
‚Äî Events sequence and completion rate % for funnel üèÜ ![dau-mau.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/dau_mau_0b8c0cf142.png)
‚Äî DAU/WAU ratio curve on the Active user template üìä
‚Äî Design polish: active users insights, scattered plot graph, feature audit graph, new tool tips, new hover effect üíÖ

articles.title: Power Users template
articles.content:
We added a new template based on this article from [a16z](https://a16z.com/2018/08/06/power-user-curve-l30-l7/)
**New design of users and event page** We redesigned the events page to allow you to better organise your events: ![events.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/events_a8e85ab903.png) The users page also got a revamp with more information and search: ![users.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/users_1fd3a251da.png)
**Improved digest and weekly digest** We added a new WAU Slack digest. We also improved events notifications to allow custom messages, with traits and information from your users ![digest.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/digest_69f559f869.png)
**Other improvements** - Teammate management redesigned - Time range for DAU graph (7, 15 or 30 days) - We redesigned our bar chart component - Added DAU/MAU ratio graph

articles.title: Active Groups template
articles.content:
We added support for account-level analytics with the Active Groups template.
**New design of single user page** We redesigned the single user page with a better event feed and header. ![changelog-w5-2.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/changelog_w5_2_a914fd4ae0.png)
**Other improvements** - We've automated product onboarding, with just a few final touches left. Stay tuned for a self-serve onboarding experience in the coming weeks! - You can now look at the active users for each day, week, and month by clicking on individual points in the Active Users graph - You can now look at daily, weekly, and monthly Retention across any time period that you want - You can also select multiple events at the same time while creating a report - And there are confirmation toasts when you save things! - We also fixed the funnel template and learned about a subtle difference in list slices between Python and Ruby, with lots of small fixes and improvements across the app

articles.title: Goals
articles.content:
**Goals** are now available for the "Active users" template! üéâ
You can pick a goal for one of your key metrics to motivate your team. Once you pick a metric, you can set target and a deadline, and you're good to go. Once a goal is set up you can see your progress in your report header, like this: ![Capture d‚ÄôeÃÅcran 2021-02-13 aÃÄ 10.33.29.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/Capture_d_ecran_2021_02_13_a_10_33_29_911320bfbe.png)
**Other improvements** - You can get a quick pulse of a feature usage with the "Engagement" template - The Feature Audit works for larger organisations - bar chart is also fully explained - Template set up flow is more comfortable to take (full-width) - You can self-serve onboard on June if you use Segment! - You can preview templates on their public pages - Funnel design shows you the completion rate at each step. You can also zoom in on the users that dropped off at each step - We added delightful empty states on user and event list, as well as a nice onboarding video

articles.title: New reports page
articles.content:
We redesigned our report pages. This update brings your numbers front and center so you don't have to scroll to see your results.
**Other improvements** * Faster loading times for most of the templates in the app * Funnels show the order of events * You can rename templates by clicking on their title in the template page * The sidebar automatically closes when you're looking at a template * When you sign up you're now welcomed by a short video tutorial * You can now rename your workspace * Tens of small bug fixes and tweaks across the app * We redesigned most of [our website](http://june.so/)!

articles.title: Acquisition Cohorts
articles.content:
We enhanced the acquisition cohorts on the retention template to let you look at all the users in a cohort, and see the ones that were retained in subsequent days, weeks, or months. You can also choose between percentages and counts. ![changelog-w8-acquisition-cohorts.gif](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/changelog_w8_acquisition_cohorts_fa8fb1e158.gif)
**Other improvements** - You can now enable Slack messages for when you achieve the goals that you've set! - You can now also choose the desired frequency (daily, weekly, or monthly) on retention template - We also added an option for you to sort your reports by recency or popularity - On the settings page, you can now look at the number of free plan actions you've used in the current month - We also tuned our SQL queries to improve report loading speeds, with lots of small bug fixes and improvements across the app

articles.title: Improved feature usage
articles.content:
This week we improved the **feature usage** template. It now includes two more granular views: usage per week and per month. We also added goals to it so you can set engagement goals at a single feature level.
**Other improvements** - You can visualize your daily active users for the current day - You can now pick a trait in a pre-populated list of trait dropdown - Show full-time range on cohort tables. - WAU/MAU ratio is available on the [active user template](https://june.so/template/active-users) ![Capture d‚ÄôeÃÅcran 2021-03-08 aÃÄ 09.28.23.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/Capture_d_ecran_2021_03_08_a_09_28_23_dd65b8ab1f.png) - L30 (average number of days a month your users engage with your product) is available on the [power user template](https://june.so/template/power-users) ![Capture d‚ÄôeÃÅcran 2021-03-08 aÃÄ 09.29.48.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/Capture_d_ecran_2021_03_08_a_09_29_48_389f2dd0e5.png)

articles.title: Companies
articles.content:
You can now access **companies** using your product directly from the main menu. Click a company to see all the users within it. All you need for that is to use Segment *groups*.
**Other improvements** ![google-provider.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/google_provider_2c8f46d8cd.png) - Properties in funnel template - You can now select properties for the events in your funnels, this is particularly useful for acquisition analyses - Goals now show up in your graphs ![slack-goals.png](https://june-changelog.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/slack_goals_c689653224.png) - The Slack daily digest now includes a graph of your DAU evolved over the last week - We have a brand [new site](https://june.so/) - We spent some time doing some bug fixes across the app and upgrading our infrastructure - this work is reducing the loading times for your charts

seo.metaDescription: Discover new updates and improvements to June.

hero.title: Changelog
